text: New York, New York, usually refers to the city of New York, in the state of New York. New York, New York, may also refer to: *Manhattan, which is coterminous with New York County, New York, and is denoted on postal addresses as "New York, New York" or "New York, NY" *New York-New York Hotel and Casino, on the Las Vegas Strip in Paradise, Nevada ==Music== * New York, N.Y. (album), a 1959 jazz album by George Russell * "Theme from New York, New York", a 1977 song composed by Kander and Ebb for Liza Minnelli, later covered and popularized by Frank Sinatra * "New York, New York" (On the Town), a song from the 1944 musical On the Town, also performed by Frank Sinatra and others in the 1949 film adaptation * "New York, New York" (Moby song) * "New York, New York" (Ryan Adams song) * "New York New York" (Grandmaster Flash song) * "New York, New York" (Ja Rule song) * "New York, New York" (Tha Dogg Pound song) * "New York, New York", a song from The Last Poets (album) * "New York, New York (So Good They Named It Twice)", a 1978 song by Gerard Kenny * "New York / N.Y.", 1983 song by Nina Hagen ==Films== * New York, New York (1977 film), a 1977 drama by Martin Scorsese * N.Y., N.Y. (film), a 1957 short by Francis Thompson * New York New York (2016 film), a 2016 Chinese–Hong Kong romantic drama film ==See also== * New York (disambiguation) * New York City (disambiguation) * NYC (disambiguation) * NY (disambiguation)
title: New York, New York (disambiguation)
